content.description: Start at the base of the off-width roof crack. Interesting feet as you move out. Fun route to practice inversions (pretty rough on the knees), off-width jams, and a few chimney moves. Find the number hand jam before pulling the roof.
content.location: When coming from the trail, turn right and head along the gravel path and ridge scramble. At the end of the second larger formation.

content.description: Wider crack, decent for arm bars and a few chicken wings. There are a few helpful jugs and smaller jams up it. Nice view at the top.
content.location: Follow the trail from the main formation. This crack will be in your left in the first outcropping.

content.description: Start at the bottom of the outcropping at the end of the spine in a sit start. Climb under the prow and pull it until you top out. Bonus points if you find the sit rest in the middle. This is an extension to a climb called the Straddler. The original line took a direct approach up the prow. Both problems are fun and unique.Easier for smaller climbers. Starts out as a lowball almost. Dodge the trees and avoid nearby rocks for support.
content.location: Follow the ridge trail until the end. There is a smattering of small boulders here and some gullies.

content.description: The rock outcropping to the west of the main wall. Short routes, traverses, and a few boulder problems.
